message.content:
cs.HC, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.CV, cs.CL

The paper focuses on exploring non-verbal communication features in virtual and augmented reality mediated communication settings. This involves analyzing the impact of avatar representation, micro-expressions, body scale, head pose, and hand gestures on user experience in one-on-one conversations. Therefore, the most likely category is Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC), followed by Graphics (cs.GR) and Multimedia (cs.MM). Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) are also possible categories, as they may be relevant for analyzing micro-expressions and language use in communication.
